pageContent: Objective: As many men diagnosed with prostate cancer (PC) are now living well beyond diagnosis and treatment, these survival gains necessitate improved understanding of long-term survivorship experiences. This is the first qualitative study that aimed to provide insights into PC survivors' adjustment to diagnosis and any persisting or emerging cancer/treatment-related issues over 15+ years.

metaData.source:
Disparities in colorectal cancer screening among breast and prostate cancer survivors
https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/33544443/
